Here are some key Wikipedia links and resources to help you track the world economy:

1. Macroeconomic Indicators

  • List of countries by GDP (nominal)
  • List of countries by GDP (PPP)
  • List of countries by unemployment rate
  • List of countries by inflation rate
  • List of countries by electricity production

2. Corporate and Financial Data

  • List of largest corporate profits and losses
  • List of companies by market capitalization
  • List of largest companies by revenue
  • List of largest stock exchanges

3. International Trade

  • List of countries by exports
  • List of countries by imports

4. Urban Economy

  • List of cities by GDP
  • List of cities by number of millionaires

5. Demographics and Infrastructure

  • List of countries by population
  • List of busiest airports by passenger traffic
  • List of busiest container ports

6. Human Development and Society

  • List of countries by Human Development Index
  • List of languages by total number of speakers
  • Languages used on the Internet

7. Technology and Digital Economy

  • TIOBE Index
  • LMArena AI
  • List of most-visited websites
  • List of most-downloaded Google Play applications
  • List of most downloaded apps on the Apple App Store

8. Wealth and Billionaires

  • The World’s Billionaires
  • List of countries by number of millionaires

9. Data Sources and Reports

  • World Economic Outlook Reports (IMF)
  • World Bank Open Data
  • OECD Data
  • Our World in Data - National GDP (Constant USD, World Bank)
